thread.title: Local Rundown: Badgers', Bears' runners excel in separate races Wednesday
thread.title_full: Local Rundown: Badgers', Bears' runners excel in separate races Wednesday

title: Local Rundown: Badgers', Bears' runners excel in separate races Wednesday
text: Local Rundown: Badgers', Bears' runners excel in separate races Wednesday The Daily Courier PREP CROSS-COUNTRYPrescott High girls 1st, boys 2nd vs. Goldwater in Phoenix The Badgers' girls' cross-country team won a three-way meet versus host Barry Goldwater and Liberty Wednesday afternoon, Sept. 30, at Reach 11 Sports Complex in Phoenix.Prescott scored 20 points, finishing well ahead of runner-up Liberty (49 points) and third-place Goldwater (68).Individually for PHS, five girls placed in the Top 10, including Carissa Evans (second), Katie Townsend (third), Maggie Dunkel (fourth), Swayze Smith (fifth) and Lacy Dobbins (sixth).On the boys' side, Goldwater won the team race with 25 points, followed by PHS (second, 32 points) and Liberty (third, 79).Individually for Prescott, Nakai Lake placed second in 17 minutes and 50 seconds.Next up, the Badgers will run at the Desert Twilight Invitational at 4 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, in Casa Grande. Bradshaw boys victorious vs. La Joya, Peoria Bradshaw Mountain's boys' cross-country team won a three-way meet against La Joya and host Peoria at Rio Vista Park late Wednesday afternoon, Sept. 30.The Bears registered 34 points, followed by second-place La Joya (44) and third-place Peoria (48).Individually, Bradshaw's Alex Villagran won the race in 18 minutes, 10 seconds. David Villagran (second place, 18:11), Emilio Mendibles (seventh, 18:46), Eddie Miner (ninth, 20:20) and Arthur Castenada (14th, 20:40) followed for the Bears.On the girls' side, Peoria won as a team. Bradshaw didn't field a full girls' squad, but it had two individual finishers in Anna Zea (seventh, 24:30) and Cece Depue (18th, 28:44).Next up, the Bears will run in the Desert Twilight Invitational Friday, Oct. 2, in Casa Grande. PREP SOCCERChino Valley girls 9, Grand Canyon 0 Chino Valley High's girls' soccer team won its sixth straight match on Wednesday, Sept. 30, after this blowout of Grand Canyon on the road.Lauren Foster tallied two goals and two assists, Katie Farnsworth registered two goals and an assist, and Sable Padilla knocked in two goals in the Cougars' convincing victory.Chino coach Allen Foster said several of his players received minutes Wednesday. That was partly done to prepare for defending fall soccer state champion Blue Ridge (11-0 overall record), whom the Cougars will open up against at the Old Pueblo Classic at noon Friday, Oct. 2, in Tucson.Chino Valley (8-3 overall, 6-1 in power-point matches) will continue play in the Classic at 3:30 p.m. Friday against Show Low before playing two more matches in the tournament on Saturday, Oct. 3.
